L2_gloss:
to be two
Napuʼ japi ôcjeclôi napuʼjop. ― There were two women together.

suffix indicating the material an object is made of
‎clesa (“iron wire, metal”) + ‎-nilh → ‎clesanilh (“iron”)
‎yeclôʼ (“wood”) + ‎-nilh → ‎yeclônilh (“wood”)

to be three
Ya’pu’ja’naelh. ― We are three.

similative suffx, used with names of animals and plants to indicate a different species
‎cuvôyu (“horse”) + ‎-taj → ‎cuvôyutaj (“donkey”)
‎tashinsha (“deer”) + ‎-taj → ‎tashinshtaj (“sheep”)
‎napʼuc (“salted shrub”) + ‎-taj → ‎naapcutaj (“salt”)

to be one, alone
Ni nen ca veʼlha. ― He does not like to live alone.
